intro: Veronica ruprechtii, commonly known as the Alpine speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and often covered with a fine, whitish bloom. Veronica ruprechtii thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments.
